Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that manages external processes, handling their input/output streams and providing control over process execution, including starting, stopping, and monitoring.

Class Description: The DaemonHandler class is designed to manage external processes executed via ProcessBuilder. It provides functionality to start processes with either delimited or undelimited output handling, stop processes (either gracefully or forcibly), and retrieve process exit codes. The class maintains separate threads for handling standard output and error streams, with output being captured and placed into a shared blocking deque.

Attributes:
- processBuilder: ProcessBuilder - Configures and starts external processes
- process: Process - Represents the currently running external process
- outThread: Thread - Thread handling standard output stream
- errThread: Thread - Thread handling error output stream
- errProxy: OutputProxy - Proxy for handling error stream output
- outProxy: OutputProxy - Proxy for handling standard output stream
- deque: BlockingDeque<Event> - Shared queue for process output events
- stdOut: boolean - Flag indicating whether to capture standard output

Methods:
- DaemonHandler(BlockingDeque<Event>, String...) -> void - Constructor that initializes the process handler with output queue and command
- setStdOutListener(boolean) -> void - Sets whether to capture standard output
- startDelimited() -> Process - Starts process with delimited output handling (using default delimiter)
- startDelimited(byte) -> Process - Starts process with custom delimiter for output handling
- startUndelimited() -> Process - Starts process with undelimited output handling (default buffer size)
- startUndelimited(int) -> Process - Starts process with undelimited output handling (custom buffer size)
- stop(boolean) -> void - Stops the managed process (optionally forcibly)
- getExitCode() -> int - Retrieves the exit code of the process (or PROCESS_STOPPED if not running)
